info.description:
Security Hub provides you with a comprehensive view of the security state of your AWS environment and resources. It also provides you with the compliance status of your environment based on CIS AWS Foundations compliance checks. Security Hub collects security data from AWS accounts, services, and integrated third-party products and helps you analyze security trends in your environment to identify the highest priority security issues. For more information about Security Hub, see the AWS Security Hub User Guide .

When you use operations in the Security Hub API, the requests are executed only in the AWS Region that is currently active or in the specific AWS Region that you specify in your request. Any configuration or settings change that results from the operation is applied only to that Region. To make the same change in other Regions, execute the same command for each Region to apply the change to. For example, if your Region is set to us-west-2, when you use CreateMembers to add a member account to Security Hub, the association of the member account with the master account is created only in the us-west-2 Region. Security Hub must be enabled for the member account in the same Region that the invite was sent from.
info.title: AWS SecurityHub

delete.description:
Disables Security Hub in your account only in the current Region. To disable Security Hub in all Regions, you must submit one request per Region where you have enabled Security Hub. When you disable Security Hub for a master account, it doesn't disable Security Hub for any associated member accounts.

When you disable Security Hub, your existing findings and insights and any Security Hub configuration settings are deleted after 90 days and can't be recovered. Any standards that were enabled are disabled, and your master and member account associations are removed. If you want to save your existing findings, you must export them before you disable Security Hub.

get.description: Returns details about the Hub resource in your account, including the HubArn and the time when you enabled Security Hub.

HubArn.description: The ARN of the Hub resource to retrieve.

post.description: Enables Security Hub for your account in the current Region or the Region you specify in the request. When you enable Security Hub, you grant to Security Hub the permissions necessary to gather findings from AWS Config, Amazon GuardDuty, Amazon Inspector, and Amazon Macie. To learn more, see Setting Up AWS Security Hub.

Tags.description: The tags to add to the Hub resource when you enable Security Hub.

post.description: Creates a custom action target in Security Hub. You can use custom actions on findings and insights in Security Hub to trigger target actions in Amazon CloudWatch Events.

Description.description: The description for the custom action target.

Id.description: The ID for the custom action target.

Name.description: The name of the custom action target.

post.description: Returns a list of the custom action targets in Security Hub in your account.

parameters.description: Pagination limit
parameters.name: MaxResults

parameters.description: Pagination token
parameters.name: NextToken

ActionTargetArns.description: A list of custom action target ARNs for the custom action targets to retrieve.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of results to return.

NextToken.description: The token that is required for pagination.

delete.description: Deletes a custom action target from Security Hub. Deleting a custom action target doesn't affect any findings or insights that were already sent to Amazon CloudWatch Events using the custom action.

parameters.description: The ARN of the custom action target to delete.
parameters.name: ActionTargetArn

patch.description: Updates the name and description of a custom action target in Security Hub.

parameters.description: The ARN of the custom action target to update.
parameters.name: ActionTargetArn

Description.description: The updated description for the custom action target.

Name.description: The updated name of the custom action target.

patch.description: Updates the Note and RecordState of the Security Hub-aggregated findings that the filter attributes specify. Any member account that can view the finding also sees the update to the finding.

Filters.description: A collection of attributes that are applied to all active Security Hub-aggregated findings and that result in a subset of findings that are included in this insight.

RecordState.description: The updated record state for the finding.

post.description: Returns a list of findings that match the specified criteria.

parameters.description: Pagination limit
parameters.name: MaxResults

parameters.description: Pagination token
parameters.name: NextToken

Filters.description: A collection of attributes that are applied to all active Security Hub-aggregated findings and that result in a subset of findings that are included in this insight.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of findings to return.

NextToken.description: Paginates results. On your first call to the GetFindings operation, set the value of this parameter to NULL. For subsequent calls to the operation, fill nextToken in the request with the value of nextToken from the previous response to continue listing data.

SortCriteria.description: Findings attributes used to sort the list of findings returned.

post.description: Imports security findings generated from an integrated third-party product into Security Hub. This action is requested by the integrated product to import its findings into Security Hub. The maximum allowed size for a finding is 240 Kb. An error is returned for any finding larger than 240 Kb.

Findings.description: A list of findings to import. To successfully import a finding, it must follow the AWS Security Finding Format.

post.description: Creates a custom insight in Security Hub. An insight is a consolidation of findings that relate to a security issue that requires attention or remediation. Use the GroupByAttribute to group the related findings in the insight.

Filters.description: A collection of attributes that are applied to all active Security Hub-aggregated findings and that result in a subset of findings that are included in this insight.

GroupByAttribute.description: The attribute used as the aggregator to group related findings for the insight.

Name.description: The name of the custom insight to create.

post.description: Lists and describes insights that insight ARNs specify.

parameters.description: Pagination limit
parameters.name: MaxResults

parameters.description: Pagination token
parameters.name: NextToken

InsightArns.description: The ARNs of the insights that you want to describe.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of items that you want in the response.

NextToken.description: Paginates results. On your first call to the GetInsights operation, set the value of this parameter to NULL. For subsequent calls to the operation, fill nextToken in the request with the value of nextToken from the previous response to continue listing data.

get.description: Lists the results of the Security Hub insight that the insight ARN specifies.

parameters.description: The ARN of the insight whose results you want to see.
parameters.name: InsightArn

delete.description: Deletes the insight specified by the InsightArn.

parameters.description: The ARN of the insight to delete.
parameters.name: InsightArn

patch.description: Updates the Security Hub insight that the insight ARN specifies.

parameters.description: The ARN of the insight that you want to update.
parameters.name: InsightArn

Filters.description: A collection of attributes that are applied to all active Security Hub-aggregated findings and that result in a subset of findings that are included in this insight.

GroupByAttribute.description: The updated GroupBy attribute that defines this insight.

Name.description: The updated name for the insight.

get.description: Lists all Security Hub membership invitations that were sent to the current AWS account.

parameters.description: The maximum number of items that you want in the response.
parameters.name: MaxResults

parameters.description: Paginates results. On your first call to the ListInvitations operation, set the value of this parameter to NULL. For subsequent calls to the operation, fill nextToken in the request with the value of NextToken from the previous response to continue listing data.
parameters.name: NextToken

get.description: Returns the count of all Security Hub membership invitations that were sent to the current member account, not including the currently accepted invitation.

post.description: Declines invitations to become a member account.

AccountIds.description: A list of account IDs that specify the accounts that invitations to Security Hub are declined from.

post.description: Deletes invitations received by the AWS account to become a member account.

AccountIds.description: A list of the account IDs that sent the invitations to delete.

get.description: Provides the details for the Security Hub master account to the current member account.

post.description: Accepts the invitation to be a member account and be monitored by the Security Hub master account that the invitation was sent from. When the member account accepts the invitation, permission is granted to the master account to view findings generated in the member account.

InvitationId.description: The ID of the invitation sent from the Security Hub master account.

MasterId.description: The account ID of the Security Hub master account that sent the invitation.

post.description: Disassociates the current Security Hub member account from the associated master account.

get.description: Lists details about all member accounts for the current Security Hub master account.

parameters.description: Specifies which member accounts the response includes based on their relationship status with the master account. The default value is TRUE. If onlyAssociated is set to TRUE, the response includes member accounts whose relationship status with the master is set to ENABLED or DISABLED. If onlyAssociated is set to FALSE, the response includes all existing member accounts.
parameters.name: OnlyAssociated

parameters.description: The maximum number of items that you want in the response.
parameters.name: MaxResults

parameters.description: Paginates results. Set the value of this parameter to NULL on your first call to the ListMembers operation. For subsequent calls to the operation, fill nextToken in the request with the value of nextToken from the previous response to continue listing data.
parameters.name: NextToken

post.description:
Creates a member association in Security Hub between the specified accounts and the account used to make the request, which is the master account. To successfully create a member, you must use this action from an account that already has Security Hub enabled. You can use the EnableSecurityHub to enable Security Hub.

After you use CreateMembers to create member account associations in Security Hub, you need to use the InviteMembers action, which invites the accounts to enable Security Hub and become member accounts in Security Hub. If the invitation is accepted by the account owner, the account becomes a member account in Security Hub, and a permission policy is added that permits the master account to view the findings generated in the member account. When Security Hub is enabled in the invited account, findings start being sent to both the member and master accounts.

You can remove the association between the master and member accounts by using the DisassociateFromMasterAccount or DisassociateMembers operation.

AccountDetails.description: A list of account ID and email address pairs of the accounts to associate with the Security Hub master account.

post.description: Deletes the specified member accounts from Security Hub.

AccountIds.description: A list of account IDs of the member accounts to delete.

post.description: Disassociates the specified member accounts from the associated master account.

AccountIds.description: The account IDs of the member accounts to disassociate from the master account.

post.description: Returns the details on the Security Hub member accounts that the account IDs specify.

AccountIds.description: A list of account IDs for the Security Hub member accounts that you want to return the details for.

post.description: Invites other AWS accounts to become member accounts for the Security Hub master account that the invitation is sent from. Before you can use this action to invite a member, you must first create the member account in Security Hub by using the CreateMembers action. When the account owner accepts the invitation to become a member account and enables Security Hub, the master account can view the findings generated from member account.

AccountIds.description: A list of IDs of the AWS accounts that you want to invite to Security Hub as members.

get.description: Lists all findings-generating solutions (products) whose findings you have subscribed to receive in Security Hub.

parameters.description: Paginates results. On your first call to the ListEnabledProductsForImport operation, set the value of this parameter to NULL. For subsequent calls to the operation, fill nextToken in the request with the value of NextToken from the previous response to continue listing data.
parameters.name: NextToken

parameters.description: The maximum number of items that you want in the response.
parameters.name: MaxResults

post.description: Enables the integration of a partner product with Security Hub. Integrated products send findings to Security Hub. When you enable a product integration, a permission policy that grants permission for the product to send findings to Security Hub is applied.

ProductArn.description: The ARN of the product to enable the integration for.

delete.description: Disables the integration of the specified product with Security Hub. Findings from that product are no longer sent to Security Hub after the integration is disabled.

parameters.description: The ARN of the integrated product to disable the integration for.
parameters.name: ProductSubscriptionArn

get.description: Returns information about the products available that you can subscribe to and integrate with Security Hub to consolidate findings.

parameters.description: The token that is required for pagination.
parameters.name: NextToken

parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return.
parameters.name: MaxResults

post.description: Disables the standards specified by the provided StandardsSubscriptionArns. For more information, see Standards Supported in AWS Security Hub.

StandardsSubscriptionArns.description: The ARNs of the standards subscriptions to disable.

post.description: Returns a list of the standards that are currently enabled.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of results to return in the response.

NextToken.description: Paginates results. On your first call to the GetEnabledStandards operation, set the value of this parameter to NULL. For subsequent calls to the operation, fill nextToken in the request with the value of nextToken from the previous response to continue listing data.

StandardsSubscriptionArns.description: A list of the standards subscription ARNs for the standards to retrieve.

post.description: Enables the standards specified by the provided standardsArn. In this release, only CIS AWS Foundations standards are supported. For more information, see Standards Supported in AWS Security Hub.

StandardsSubscriptionRequests.description:
The list of standards compliance checks to enable.

In this release, Security Hub supports only the CIS AWS Foundations standard.

The ARN for the standard is arn:aws:securityhub:::ruleset/cis-aws-foundations-benchmark/v/1.2.0.

get.description: Returns a list of tags associated with a resource.

parameters.description: The ARN of the resource to retrieve tags for.
parameters.name: ResourceArn

post.description: Adds one or more tags to a resource.

parameters.description: The ARN of the resource to apply the tags to.
parameters.name: ResourceArn

Tags.description: The tags to add to the resource.

delete.description: Removes one or more tags from a resource.

parameters.description: The ARN of the resource to remove the tags from.
parameters.name: ResourceArn

parameters.description: The tag keys associated with the tags to remove from the resource.
parameters.name: tagKeys

servers.description: The AWS SecurityHub endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)
The AWS SecurityHub endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)

AccountDetails.description: The details of an AWS account.

AwsEc2InstanceDetails.description: The details of an Amazon EC2 instance.

AwsIamAccessKeyDetails.description: IAM access key details related to a finding.

AwsS3BucketDetails.description: The details of an Amazon S3 bucket.

AwsSecurityFinding.description:
Provides consistent format for the contents of the Security Hub-aggregated findings. AwsSecurityFinding format enables you to share findings between AWS security services and third-party solutions, and compliance checks.

A finding is a potential security issue generated either by AWS services (Amazon GuardDuty, Amazon Inspector, and Amazon Macie) or by the integrated third-party solutions and compliance checks.

AwsSecurityFindingFilters.description: A collection of attributes that are applied to all active Security Hub-aggregated findings and that result in a subset of findings that are included in this insight.

Compliance.description: Exclusive to findings that are generated as the result of a check run against a specific rule in a supported standard (for example, CIS AWS Foundations). Contains compliance-related finding details.

ContainerDetails.description: Container details related to a finding.

DateFilter.description: A date filter for querying findings.

DateRange.description: A date range for the date filter.

ImportFindingsError.description: Includes details of the list of the findings that can't be imported.

Insight.description: Contains information about a Security Hub insight.

InsightResultValue.description: The insight result values returned by the GetInsightResults operation.

InsightResults.description: The insight results returned by the GetInsightResults operation.

IpFilter.description: The IP filter for querying findings.

KeywordFilter.description: A keyword filter for querying findings.

Malware.description: A list of malware related to a finding.

MapFilter.description: The map filter for querying findings.

Member.description: The details about a member account.

Network.description: The details of network-related information about a finding.

Note.description: A user-defined note added to a finding.

NumberFilter.description: A number filter for querying findings.

ProcessDetails.description: The details of process-related information about a finding.

Recommendation.description: A recommendation on how to remediate the issue identified in a finding.

Remediation.description: Details about the remediation steps for a finding.

Resource.description: A resource related to a finding.

ResourceDetails.description: Additional details about a resource related to a finding.

Result.description: Details about the account that wasn't processed.

SortCriterion.description: A collection of finding attributes used to sort findings.

StandardsSubscription.description: A resource that represents your subscription to a supported standard.

StandardsSubscriptionRequest.description: The standard that you want to enable.

StringFilter.description: A string filter for querying findings.

ThreatIntelIndicator.description: Details about the threat intel related to a finding.
